newsitem.title: UK: BFI up five but market quieter.
newsitem.headline: BFI up five but market quieter.

text.p: The Baltic Freight Index (BFI) was up five on Wednesday to 1,288 points in quiet trading.

Brokers said the Index was influenced primarily by firmer Caper fixtures in the Atlantic with the Keoyang fixture of Leopardi 125,000 coal La Cienaga/Ensted for June 15/30 at $6.85 (up about 20 cents) and Hoogovens fixing Amber for 150,000 iron ore Turarao to Ymuiden for June 20/30 at very close to $6.00 (up 10 cents).
Confusion surrounded the latest Gulf to Japan fixture of Global Challeneger for 54,000 heavy grain by HMM for early June, reports varying between $21.75 and $22.15 no combo.
In the Pacific British Steel bixed Samjohn Light 73,000 dwt delivery prompt Japan for a coal trip via Roberts Bank to UK at close to $7,250 daily.
At 1200 GMT BIFFEX was five to 15 points lower and turnover totalled 81 lots.
